lead_paragraph: The battle scenes and the sound of automatic gunfire inside Kirkuk were reminiscent of the Islamic State’s brazen march across northern Iraq in 2014.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Omar al-Jawoshy from Baghdad; Falih Hassan from Erbil; an employee of The New York Times from Kirkuk, Iraq; Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva; and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

headline.print_headline: Islamic State Fighters in Iraq Attack Kirkuk, Diverting Attention From Mosul
headline.main: ISIS Fighters in Iraq Attack Kirkuk, Diverting Attention From Mosul

snippet: The battle scenes and the sound of automatic gunfire inside Kirkuk were reminiscent of the Islamic State’s brazen march across northern Iraq in 2014....
abstract: Islamic State fighters attack strategic oil city of Kirkuk, drawing attention from battle group is waging with Iraqi army in Mosul.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
